page.title: 05POWER STATION RICHBOROUGH
page.content: The power station at Richborough was commissioned in 1962. 180 people work there and most of these people live near to it. 5 to 8 people man the station at night. An 8 hour day is worked. {Cooling:} The cooling water(10 million gallons per hour - recycled) is taken from the Stour into 3 cooling towers. {Oil:} The oil is brought from the refineries via the River Thames to Ramsgate by barges and then to the station via road tankers. This takes 50 journeys for every 1000 tonne load. {Gas:} To convert from expensive oil to cheap gas it would cost over Â£1,000000 but as Richborough is only a back up station this is not feasible. {Output:} The maximum is 356-380 MW, achieved in the 84/85 miners strike proving the value of this station.
